intro: Rhysotoechia congesta, commonly known as the clustered rhysotome, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom during the wet season. Its leaves are typically ovate and have a soft, hairy texture. Rhysotoechia congesta is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
